result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared R Puzio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
8:59 AM cases 20CF711, 21CF821, 22CF350, 22CF572, 22CF637, 22CF843 called.  Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jared R Puzio in court with Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee.
There is an agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements
22CF843: Defendant waives reading of Complaint and is advised of charges/potential penalties. No bond set.
22CF637, 22CF843, 22CF572 and 22CF350: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver.
20CF711: DAGP in Count 1 is vacated, court finds the Defendant guilty. 
22CF637: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 5: Disorderly Conduct and Count 6: Criminal Damage to Property
22CF843: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2: Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm
21CF821: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2: Disorderly Conduct and Count 3: Criminal Damage to Property
22CF572: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer and Count 2: Bail Jumping-Felony
22CF350: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 3: Criminal Damage to Property and Count 4: Bail Jumping-Felony Domestic Abuse

Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights.
Court accepts the pleas and finds the Defendant guilty.

Court orders:
In 20CF711, 21CF821, 22CF350, 22CF572, 22CF637, 22CF843:
3 years Probation
In 20CF711: 120 days of jail stayed pending further order of the court, Huber or Electronic Monitoring granted if available. 
AODA and follow through with recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
No Contact with T.S., A.B., 6915 Curvue Road Eau Claire WI, M.W., T.A., 1208 Newman Street Bloomer, WI.
No Contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.
No Contact with Mayo Hospital or staff unless it is a bona fide emergency.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone, including members of family
Anger/Aggression assessment and follow through with treatment
Court costs including $100 paper service fee in 20CF711 and Domestic Surcharge in 22CF350
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 

21CF821: Restitution for $500 plus 10% surcharge
22CF637: Restitution for $640 plus 10% surcharge 
State has 60 days to request additional restitution.

2 days of jail credit in 22CF350
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

(2:32 PM cases 20CF711, 21CF821, 22CF350, 22CF572, 22CF637 called.) Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jared R Puzio in court. Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee in court for Jared R Puzio.
Attorney Caffee advises is not appointed on the defendant's newest cases.
Defendant advises hasn't received or seen a copy of the complaint in 22CF637.
Attorney Caffee provides the defendant with a copy and Court advises to take a few minutes to review.
(Off record to allow the defendant to review the complaint in 22CF637.)
Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing in 22CF637.
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Status Conference in 21CF821, Order to Show Cause in 20CF711 and Hearing in 22CF350, 22CF572, 22CF637 scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 9 am (1/2 hour) in person.

Defense indicates she has not yet been appointed to 22CF350- requests a new Status Conference. Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
Order to Show Cause in 20CF711, Status Conference in 21CF821, and Hearing in 22CF350: 06/27/2022 at 2:30 PM.
